The compound 'hydrogen chloride' has the chemical formula . At room temperature,
it is a colorless gas, which forms white fumes of hydrochloric acid upon contact
with atmospheric humidity. Hydrogen chloride gas and hydrochloric acid are
important in technology and industry. Hydrochloric acid, the aqueous solution of
hydrogen chloride, is also commonly given the formula HCl.
